diagnoses.label: Malignant meningioma
evidence_spans: He said he has had two surgeries in 07/06 followed by radiation and then again in 08/07.
This shows that he has had progression of disease with recurrence along the surface of the brain and there is significant brain edema.

medications.name: Decadron
evidence_spans: Decadron 6 mg four times a day

followups.when: both with him and his family
evidence_spans: I discussed this both with him, although it is not clear to me how much he understood, as well as his family.

patient_summary: Mr. A is a new patient who has a malignant meningioma. He has had surgeries, radiation, and seizures. He is currently in a nursing home and unable to care for himself. The doctor does not think surgery will help Mr. A's quality of life. The doctor discussed surgery with Mr. A and his family.

missing_info.why_required: to determine where the patient will be discharged
to determine if the patient will be discharged home, to a facility, or to hospice
to determine if chemotherapy is being considered

notes: The patient's cognitive status is unclear. The doctor did not explicitly state whether the patient understood the discussion about surgery. The patient's current condition is described as significant disability and not independent. The doctor's opinion is that surgery is not in the patient's best interest.
